result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steffon Serrel Carter

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Violation Report
Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.

8:34 AM Defendant Steffon Serrel Carter appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz appeared by video for Steffon Serrel Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants motion to modify bond. Court orders cash bond of $2000 set with conditions of  Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint prior to being released from custody.
Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Steffon S Carter in court, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Steffon S Carter. Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steffon Serrel Carter appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Keith Venema appeared on behalf of Bradley J. Lochowicz for Steffon Serrel Carter. Court takes Judicial Notice of 22CF879. Officer Alexander Limberg sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney enters not guilty plea on Defendants behalf and jury trial to be set. Defense requests bond modification, State objects. Court denies bond modification.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $3500 with conditions. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits by zoom.
